creator: Mitsuru.Sato@fujixerox.co.jp
text:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup Apache, OpenSSL, mod_SSL, mod_jk and Tomcat.
2. Setup JSP file for test.
----- CertTypeTest.jsp -----
<%=request.getAttribute("javax.servlet.request.X509Certificate")
.getClass().getName()%>
-----
3. access the JSP file using https with client certificate.

Actual Results:
"java.lang.String" is displaied in browser.

Expected Results:
"[Ljava.security.cert.X509Certificate;" is displaied in browser.
(ref. Servlet 2.2 spec. Section 5.7)

Additional Information:
at Tomcat + JSSE (standalone) configuration, 
"com.sun.security.cert.internal.x509.X509V1CertImpl" is displaied.
(also bug)

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I'm not sure we can fix it for 3.3, but probably in a future bug-fix release.
With Apache+SSL I'm not sure how we can resolve this without requiring JSSE (
since apache has SSL already in ) or how those will work togheter. 

I think you can construct the cert without using JSSE, but not sure how. There
is also a small problem with sending the full chain from Apache, we need to
check that one too.
